solution_line_template: Justin would spend {dinner_time} minutes at dinner, {homework_time} minutes doing homework, {room_cleaning_time} minutes cleaning his room, {trash_time} minutes on the trash and {dishwasher_time} on dishes for a total of {dinner_time}+{homework_time}+{room_cleaning_time}+{trash_time}+{dishwasher_time} = <<{dinner_time}+{homework_time}+{room_cleaning_time}+{trash_time}+{dishwasher_time}={total_minutes_work}>>{total_minutes_work}

Justin knows that {minutes_per_hour}min is the same as 1 hour. He has {total_minutes_work} minutes of work so {total_minutes_work}/{minutes_per_hour} = <<{total_minutes_work}/{minutes_per_hour}={total_hours_work}>>{total_hours_work} hours

His movie comes on at {movie_start_time_pm} pm and he has {total_hours_work} hours of chores so {movie_start_time_pm}-{total_hours_work} = <<{movie_start_time_pm}-{total_hours_work}={latest_start_time_pm}>>{latest_start_time_pm} pm is the latest time he could start his chores
